content: **velvet plush crochet kitty** > **pattern notes ** i have never worked with this type of yarn before and i > did not want a design that was too > challenging the size of the hook was > already something to get used to my > daughter suggested the kitty and i was > only too willing to oblige > > i made another kitty in the cotton > yarn to show the difference yarn can > do to the pattern **difficulty level | skills required** easy - suitable for beginners basic stitches in simple variations shaping and finishing you will need to know basic stitches like single_crochet single_crochet special stitches explained and provided in the instructions **materials** hook 6 00 mm / optional - for smaller kitty 3 50 mm e stitch marker scissors yarn needle safety eyes 14 mm / optional for smaller kitty 7 mm **yarn ** alize velluto 100 grams / 74 3 yards / 68 meters 1 x 100g color 414 azure 10/15 g vinnis colours nikkim color grey for features any yarn can be used optional for smaller kitty - vinnis colours dk nikkim 100% cotton 50 grams/119 meters weight dk 11 wpi 3 light 1 x 50g color 591 kingfisher 5/10 g vinnis colours nikkim color grey for features **yarn substitute ** using the same type of yarn throughout the project is recommended the pattern suggests velvet yarn but you are not limited to this type of yarn any yarn can be used if you take into consideration your sizing for the project will differ and will look differently **gauge | gauge** gauge is not necessary for this project to be perfect however counting your stitches will ensure a true success of this project **size** velluto kitty 7 inches 18 cm in length and 6 inches 15 cm in width at the widest section of the body nikkim kitty 3 inches 8 cm in length and 3 inches 8 cm in width at the widest section of the body remember if you use/choose a different yarn weight/hook size your kitty will be a different size and will also most likely look different **abbreviations us terminology** **pattern support** full pattern support is available from the joanita theron designs facebook group or/and joanita theron designs ravelry group please post a question in the group and remember to tag me i will assist as soon as possible or one of my members will gladly jump in to help for questions relating to permission or usage email joanita@creativecrochetworkshop com
